name: (2-amino-3,5-dimethylphenyl)(phenyl)methanol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2762
Reason: 2-Amino-3,5-dimethylphenyl and phenyl groups both contribute to the melting point. The amino group introduces a basic nitrogen, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C. The methyl groups also contribute to the melting point due to their increased molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at around +5°C each. The phenyl group, with its additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, raises the melting point by approximately +30°C. The methyl group within the phenyl ring also contributes to the melting point due to its increased molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at around +5°C.
